data.title: Move units which are blocking the exit of a factory structure
data.body: Units which are standing on the bib of a production building should be moved off it instead of playing the "Unable to build more" sound. If the surrounding area is blocked, these units should be nudged until space is made or no more space is available.

data.title: Order lines are not updated on cancelling the current order
data.body: After cancelling a unit's order, the order lines still show the path to the previous target.

data.title: Implement the out of range cursor
data.body:
When telling a unit or structure to attack something that is outside of its range, change the cursor to the out of range cursor (standard attack cursor with X crosshairs in RA mod). This allows the player to know if the unit will move or not before issuing the order. This is useful when walking ranged units towards base defences for example.

When a group of units is selected, the out of range cursor should be shown if any of the units is out of range.

data.title: Unselectable walls.
data.body: Did I do it rite?

data.title: Remove excess bot types from RA
data.body: There isn't enough difference between them to justify 8 different bot types. The Easy -- Hard and Island Map bot titles are also quite misleading. We should cut this down to 3-4 that actually play significantly differently.

data.title: Port RA desert shellmap to lua
Expose objectives panel to lua
Investigate switching back to OpenTK
data.body:
http://www.opentk.com/opentk-1.1-beta1-released

This would give us a uniform platform backend and let us drop our existing mess.
Moving to GLES and using ANGLE should improve windows support, and make a mobile port slightly less infeasible.

data.title: Investigate software voxel renderer
data.body:
Voxels are tricky to efficiently render in GL, and our current renderer is hacky and relatively slow.

We may be able to win some perf by doing the initial voxel -> texture renderering on the CPU, using voxel.vpl for lighting.  This would give us a regular indexed sprite that we can render using the normal shp shader. 

We would then save the FBO switch each frame plus any batch breakage from switching between the voxel and shp shaders.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1397311-investigate-software-voxel-renderer?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Transfer code from overused Mobile to IMove (and IMoveInfo)
data.body:
Changed most references of trait Mobile -> IMove.
In Mobile.cs IsMoving now has a public set as opposed to the initial internal.
Added IMoveInfo interface to go with *Info classes that use IMove.
WithRotor now uses IMove.IsMoving instead of (self.CenterPosition.Z > 0) as part of a check.

data.title: Fixes order lines not being shown after reselect
data.body: This fixes order lines having a single timeout across multiple selections and deselections, which caused order lines not to be shown when a unit was selected until the timeout expired, deselected and then reselected.

data.title: I have 1440p resolution and the game is a bit too small now
data.body:
Is it possible to include a zoom feature at all? I'm thinking like Baldur's Gate Enhanced Edition's feature, which I think is very good.

data.title: Walls and certain civilian buildings should now show health bars.
data.body:
Walls and certain civilian buildings should now show health bars. 

There is like a civilian building thats just 2 stacks of hay or something and it shows a health bar but it cant be killed, probably others.

Is there a tag like "ShowHealth=No" to put on these buildings?

data.title: Added a few Lua functions, attempt 2
data.body: Probably most noteworthy the production stuff and the FindXinCircle/Box functions

data.title: [polish] When using build all cheat, incorrect voice overs used for opposite sides units.
data.body: IE: You are soviets and build a medium tank, it will have soviet voice overs.

data.title: Registered Linux MIME type to directly load replays
data.body:
I adapted our RPM and tested it on @openSUSE with KDE.

![opensuse-kde-openra-mime](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/2051353/a50908fc-8a87-11e3-8586-606c26a0d4f0.png)

Maybe @obrakmann can help with the Debian package. It should be similar to the spec file changes.

data.title: Allow shift clicking on a single unit to toggle selection
data.body: Currently, holding shift always adds units to the current selection. Shift clicking on a single unit should toggle its selection to allow deselection of that unit. For example, box selecting a large group of assorted infantry and shift clicking to remove a medic from the middle.

data.title: obelisk health upgrade to same level as ATWR
Continue vehicle rotation on cancelling an order
data.body:
This is used in the Westwood games to turn a vehicle on the spot without changing its position: Give an order to move or force fire and then quickly cancel it. The unit continues rotating to face the order's direction of travel. This allows, for example, facing artillery units to be pointed in the expected direction of attack.

data.title: Added tank demolition with C4
data.body: also inspired from Tiberium Wars. I suspect this will not be an overpowered game changer as the commandos are still vulnerable to light vehicles. More of a nice gimmick, especially for single-player.

data.title: Show an error dialog if disconnected from the server.
data.body:
![](http://i.imgur.com/9WuD1ba.png)

This approach can be extended to cover desyncs too (in a future patch).

data.title: Pan view button occasionally "sticks"
data.body:
the icon for "pan view" can sometimes be clicked to turn pan view on and then refuse to turn off after being clicked a second time. This issue appears to be surmounted by turning on the "erase actors and resources" function via clicking the eraser icon, and turning the now-functioning "Pan view" function off via clicking the hand icon.
seems to happen randomly and go away equally randomly.

data.title: Allow mod switch when connecting to a server
data.body:
#4510 moved the last of the unwanted logic out of the handshake handling, so we can now reimplement switching mods to match the server.

This would simplify openra:// url handlers, and let us display all compatible mods in the multiplayer server browser.

data.title: Unify ra and cnc main menu logic
data.body: Unifies ra and cnc main menu logic (for the most part). This also moves a bunch of buttons into an Extras submenu and the server browser. This also lays the groundwork for a campaign menu. After this I can start on wrapping up #4035.

data.title: Catch IOExceptions in Connection.cs.
data.body: A probable fix for #4083, #4423, #4501.

data.title: Slower mechanic repair animation
data.body: it was very hectic before. This should add polishing.
